metadata.title: CVE-2017-15566 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - high
metadata.description:
Insecure SPANK environment variable handling exists in SchedMD Slurm before16.05.11, 17.x before 17.02.9, and 17.11.x before 17.11.0rc2, allowingprivilege escalation to root during Prolog or Epilog execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-slurm - 19.05.3.2-2
libpam-slurm-adopt - 19.05.3.2-2
libpmi0 - 19.05.3.2-2
libpmi2-0 - 19.05.3.2-2
libslurm-perl - 19.05.3.2-2
libslurm34 - 19.05.3.2-2
libslurmdb-perl - 19.05.3.2-2
slurm-client - 19.05.3.2-2
slurm-client-emulator - 19.05.3.2-2
slurm-wlm - 19.05.3.2-2
slurm-wlm-basic-plugins - 19.05.3.2-2
slurm-wlm-emulator - 19.05.3.2-2
slurm-wlm-torque - 19.05.3.2-2
slurmctld - 19.05.3.2-2
slurmd - 19.05.3.2-2
slurmdbd - 19.05.3.2-2
sview - 19.05.3.2-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: slurm-llnl package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '19.05.3.2-2').
